title: Peking Duck
ingredients: 1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley, for garnish
method: Step 2: Rinse duck inside and out; pat dry. Cut off tail and discard.
Step 3: Mix cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, white pepper, and cloves together in a small bowl. Sprinkle 1 teaspoon of spice mix into cavity of duck.
Step 4: Stir 1 tablespoon soy sauce into remaining spice mix and rub evenly over entire outside of duck.
Step 5: Cut 1 green onion in half and tuck it inside cavity.
Step 6: Cover and refrigerate duck for at least 2 hours or up to overnight.
Step 7: Place duck breast-side up on a rack set in a wok or pot. Steam for 1 hour, adding more water as it evaporates.
Step 8: Lift duck with two large spoons to drain juices and green onion.
Step 9: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Place duck breast-side up in a roasting pan and prick skin all over with a fork.
Step 10: Roast duck in the preheated oven for 30 minutes.
Step 11: Mix together remaining 2 tablespoons soy sauce and honey in a small bowl. Brush honey mixture onto duck.
Step 12: Increase the oven temperature to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C). Roast until skin is richly browned, about 5 minutes. Do not allow skin to char.
Step 13: Mix plum jam, chutney, sugar, and vinegar in a small serving bowl. Chop remaining green onions and place them into a separate bowl.
Step 14: Place whole duck onto a serving platter and garnish with orange slices and fresh parsley. Serve with plum sauce and chopped green onions.
